item.name: name
item.desc: Name of the interaction. The name can be arbitrary but should be unique. For bonded interactions, this should match the name specified in the mapping file.

item.name: type1
item.desc: Only for non-bonded. Bead type 1 of non-bonded interaction.

item.name: type2
item.desc: Only for non-bonded. Bead type 2 of non-bonded interaction.

item.name: min
item.desc: lower bound of interval for potential table in which calculations are performed. Should set based on reference distributions.

item.name: max
item.desc: upper bound of interval for potential table in which calculations are performed. Should set based on reference distributions.

item.name: step
item.desc: step size of interval for potential table in which calculations are performed. If step site is too small, lots of statistics is needed ( long runs ). If it's too big, features in the distribtuion/potentials might get lost.

item.name: inverse
item.desc: Contains all information important for iterative process

item.name: inverse.target
item.desc: target distribution (e.g. rdf) which is tried to match during iterations to match

item.name: inverse.do_potential
item.desc: Update cycle for the potential update. 1 means update, 0 don't update. 1 1 0 means update 2 iterations, then don't update, then repeated.

item.name: inverse.post_update
item.desc: Additional post processing of dU before added to potential. This is a list of scripts which are called separated by space. The section iterative framework for details.

item.name: inverse.post_add
item.desc: Additional post processing of U after dU added to potential. This is a list of scripts which are called separated by space. The section iterative framework for details.

item.name: inverse.p_target
item.desc: partial pressure of this species

item.name: inverse.particle_dens
item.desc: particle densisty of this species (for wjk pressure correction)

item.name: inverse.post_update_options
item.desc: Contains all options of post update scripts

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.pressure
item.desc: Contains all options of the pressure correction scripts

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.pressure.do
item.desc: pattern for pressure correction (1 do, 0 do not). Do to pressure correction every third step specify "0 0 1", similar to inverse.do_update

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.pressure.type
item.desc: Pressure correction algoritm, can be simple or wjk

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.pressure.simple
item.desc: Contains all options of the simple pressure correction script

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.pressure.simple.scale
item.desc: slope of the simple pressure correction.

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.pressure.wjk
item.desc: Contains all options of the wjk pressure correction script

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.pressure.wjk.scale
item.desc: extra scaling factor of pressure correction

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.smooth
item.desc: Contains all options of the smooth script

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.smooth.iterations
item.desc: number of iterations for triangular smooth

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.splinesmooth
item.desc: Contains all options of the spline smooth script

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.splinesmooth.step
item.desc: grid spacing for spline fit when doing spline smoothing.

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.scale
item.desc: scale factor for the update

item.name: inverse.post_add_options
item.desc: This sectioncontains all options for post add scripts.

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.copyback.filelist
item.desc: list of files to copy to the main dir

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.convergence.weight
item.desc: weight factors for the convergence of the interaction, should be a list of same length as inverse.post_add_options.convergence.what (default 1)

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.convergence.what
item.desc: list for what to calc the convergence: dist pot, .. (default dist)

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.plot.gnuplot_bin
item.desc: gnuplot binary to use (default gnuplot)

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.plot.gnuplot_opts
item.desc: extra options to give to gnuplot_bin (e.g. -persist, if one uses kill)

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.plot.fd
item.desc: file descriptor to use (default 8), make it uniqe if you want to plot multiple things

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.plot.script
item.desc: plot script to give to gnuplot

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.plot.kill
item.desc: killall process with that name before ploting (e.g. gnuplot_x11), this is more reliable than if you are using multiplot

item.name: inverse.imc
item.desc: Section containing inverse monte carlo specific options.

item.name: inverse.imc.group
item.desc: Group of interaction. Cross-correlations of all members of a group are taken into account for calculating the update. I no cross correlations should be calculated, interactions have to be put into different groujps.

item.name: inverse.gromacs
item.desc: This section contains gromacs specific options if gromacs is used as simulatiion program.

item.name: inverse.gromacs.table
item.desc: Name of file for tabulated potential of this interaction. This fill will be created from the internal tabulated potential format for every run.

item.name: inverse.espresso
item.desc: This section contains epsresso specific options if espresso is used as simulation program.

item.name: inverse.espresso.table
item.desc: Name of file for tabulated potential of this interaction. This file will be created from the internal tabulated potential format for every run. Note, though, that the original espresso blockfile needs to contain the name of that table as the tabulated interaction (see tutorial methanol ibi_espresso for details).

item.name: inverse.espresso.index1
item.desc: Index list of type1 -- Name of the Tcl variable containing all index1 particles that is contained in the espresso blockfile.

item.name: inverse.espresso.index2
item.desc: Index list of type2 -- Name of the Tcl variable containing all index2 particles that is contained in the espresso blockfile.

item.name: fmatch
item.desc: Force matching options

item.name: fmatch.min
item.desc: Minimum value of interval for distribution sampled in atomistic MD simulation. One can get this number by looking at the distribution function for this interaction. For non-bonded interactions it's the distance the rdf starts. For CG bonds and angles the variable has the similar meaning ( note, that for angles it is specified in radians ).

item.name: fmatch.max
item.desc: Maximum value of interval for distribution sampled in atomistic MD simulation. One can get this number by looking at the distribution function for this interaction. For non-bonded interactions it's the cut-off fot the interaction.

item.name: fmatch.step
item.desc: grid spacing for the spline, which represents the interaction. This parameter should not be too big, otherwise you might lose some features of the interaction potential, and not too small, otherwise you will have unsampled bins which results in a ill-defines equation system and will get NaNs in the output.

item.name: fmatch.out_step
item.desc: Grid spacing for the output grid. Normally one wants to have this parameter smaller than fmatch.step, to have smooth curve, without additional spline interpolation. As a rule of thumb we normally use fmatch.out_step which is approximately 5 times smaller than fmatch.step.
